meanings.definition: Excessive or insincere praise intended to gain favor or advantage.
meanings.sent1: Her constant flattery towards the boss was obvious to everyone in the office.
meanings.sent2: She used flattery to try to get a promotion at work.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that his dog's flattery was the reason he always got treats.
meanings.sent4: The politician's flattery towards the voters was like a sweet poison.
meanings.sent5: The flattery from the salesperson made the customer feel uncomfortable.
